intro: Clidemia xantholasia, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Clidemia xantholasia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
